concept.title: Planning the installation of a physical appliance
concept.shortdesc: Before you install the physical appliance, you must consider the hardware, cabling, and software requirements.

section.title: Points to consider when planning the installation of your physical appliance
section.p:
When you plan your installation, you might want to consider the following points:
Consider where to install your appliance within the rack. Plan the installation from the bottom of the rack cabinet.
Consider the size of the appliance. The appliance is 2U form factor. Therefore, consider the amount of rack space that you need and the number of people that are required to install .
Consider the number of sockets that you need. Two power sockets are required for each appliance.
Consider the number of power units that you need.
Consider the following cabling requirements:
You must allow space for the cable arm.
Cables must be bundled with hook-and-loop fastener strap for full movement of the cable management arm.
Allow slack in all cables to avoid tension in the cables as the cable management arm moves.
If you are configuring an HA pair of appliances, you must ensure that the appliances are close to one another so that the high speed networking cable that connects the appliances can be fitted.
Power cords and other cables are attached to the rear of the appliance, including keyboard, monitor, and mouse cables if required.
Consider the design of your power and ethernet array.
Consider how you want to use the ports.
There are 8 x 1 GbE copper ethernet ports available. Two of the ports (mgt0 and mgt1) can be used only for management traffic, for example web UI or SSH traffic. The other six ports (eth0-eth5) can be used for messaging traffic.
There are 4 x 40 GbE QSFP ports available. The ha0 and ha1 ports are used for high availability. The other two ports (eth6 and eth7) are used for messaging traffic. Ports eth6 and eth7 can be used with the Mellanox QSA adapter that is provided. You might want to use the adapter so that you can use the 40 GbE ports with 10 GbE networks.
Consider the components that you need to provide. You need to provide the following hardware and cables:
Two ethernet cables
A USB keyboard
A monitor with a VGA cable
A PC connected to the same network as the management port of the appliance
You can configure IBM Integrated Management Module II (IMM) to monitor hardware status. For information about IMM, see the IBM Integrated Management Module II User's Guide.
